Course Description: A STUDY OF ACCOUNTING CONCEPTS USED IN THE PLANNING, ORGANIZING, DIRECTING AND CONTROLLING OF BUSINESS ACTIVITIES, INCLUDING COSTING METHODS, VARIANCE ANALYSES, CAPITAL BUDGETS, AND MARGINAL COSTS.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
1. UNDERSTAND MANAGERIAL ACCOUNTING VOCABULARY IN ORDER TO SOLVE DIVERSE BUSINESS PROBLEMS.
2. UNDERSTAND MANAGERIAL ACCOUNTING TECHNIQUES USED TO PROVIDE MANAGEMENT WITH INFORMATION FOR PLANNING, CONTROLLING, AND MAKING DECISIONS.
3. UNDERSTAND HOW TO ANALYZE DATA AND TO SYNTHESIZE IT TO 
DEVELOP BUDGETS, PRODUCT COSTING SYSTEMS, AND CAPITAL 
INVESTMENT PLANS.
4. BE ABLE TO ORGANIZE DATA INTO FORMS APPROPRIATE FOR 
NON-ROUTINE MANAGERIAL ANALYSIS AND DECISION MAKING 
IN DIVERSE BUSINESS ENVIRONMENTS.
Textbook(s): GARRISON, NOREEN, & BREWER. MANAGERIAL ACCOUNTING, 13TH EDITION. IRWIN MCGRAW-HILL. ISBN 9780073379616
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
